title: Mojkovac Municipality
text:
Mojkovac Municipality (<a href="Montenegrin%20language">Montenegrin</a> and <a href="Serbian%20language">Serbian</a>: Opština Mojkovac / Општина Мојковац) is one of the <a href="municipalities%20of%20Montenegro">municipalities of Montenegro</a>. The municipality is located in northeastern region of Montenegro. Administrative center of the municipality is town of <a href="Mojkovac">Mojkovac</a>.
Geography and location.
The municipality of Mojkovac covers an area of and according to the number of inhabitants (10 015 / 2003g) belongs among the smaller municipalities in Montenegro. Mojkovac is on the west bank of the <a href="Tara%20River%20%28Montenegro%29">Tara River</a>, between the mountains of <a href="Bjelasica">Bjelasica</a> and <a href="Sinjajevina">Sinjajevina</a>. The old mining village of <a href="Brskovo">Brskovo</a> is nearby. Brskovo is one of the oldest mines in the region.
The territory of the municipality borders with municipalities: <a href="Kola%C5%A1in">Kolašin</a>, <a href="%C5%A0avnik">Šavnik</a>, <a href="%C5%BDabljak">Žabljak</a>, <a href="Bijelo%20Polje">Bijelo Polje</a> and <a href="Berane">Berane</a>. Mojkovac has a station on <a href="Belgrade%E2%80%93Bar%20railway">Belgrade–Bar railway</a>. It is also at the intersection of the main road connecting Montenegro's coast and <a href="Podgorica">Podgorica</a> with northern Montenegro and <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a> (<a href="European%20route%20E65">E65</a>, <a href="European%20route%20E80">E80</a>), and the road leading towards <a href="%C5%BDabljak">Žabljak</a> and <a href="Pljevlja">Pljevlja</a>.
Demographics.
Town of Mojkovac is administrative centre of "Mojkovac municipality", which in 2003 had a population of 10,066. The town of Mojkovac itself has 4,120 citizens.
